intro: Vicia unijuga var. venusta, commonly known as the showy vetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, round pods that contain several seeds, typical of the Fabaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Vicia unijuga var. venusta is a perennial herb that is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens with full sun exposure.
